Step 1 – Discharge all remaining pressure and extinguishing agent from the unit by pressing the handle or pull pin.
 Step 2 – Carefully remove the valve assembly and siphon tube. Inspect the cylinder wall and tube for damage or corrosion.
 Step 3 – Clean the cylinder thoroughly. Fill the cylinder with the specific extinguishing agent required (e.g., water, dry chemical).
 Step 4 – Inspect all seals, gaskets, and O-rings. Replace any worn or damaged components to ensure a proper seal.
 Step 5 – Reinstall the valve assembly and siphon tube, making sure the seal is tight. Place the unit in a proper charging device.
 Step 6 – Pressurize the unit using nitrogen or dry air to the pressure specified on the label. Re-attach the safety seal and pin.

• Always wear protective gloves and goggles
 • Work in a well-ventilated area
 • Follow manufacturer specifications exactly
 • Never refill near open flames
